text: Once spirit was God, then it became man, and now it is even becoming mob.

text: He didn't come out of my belly, but my God, I've made his bones, because I've attended to every meal, and how he sleeps, and the fact that he swims like a fish because I took him to the ocean. I'm so proud of all those things. But he is my biggest pride.

text: Thank God every morning when you get up that you have something to do that day, which must be done, whether you like it or not.

text: Start living now. Stop saving the good china for that special occasion. Stop withholding your love until that special person materializes. Every day you are alive is a special occasion. Every minute, every breath, is a gift from God.

text: The dog is the god of frolic.

text: Your belief in God is merely an escape from your monotonous, stupid and cruel life.

text: God isn't compatible with machinery and scientific medicine and universal happiness. You must make your choice. Our civilization has chosen machinery and medicine and happiness.

text: I think God's justice is making wrongs right.

text: God lends a helping hand to the man who tries hard.

text: Only one thing is impossible for God: To find any sense in any copyright law on the planet.

text: God never ends anything on a negative God always ends on a positive.

text: God gets you to the plate, but once your there your on your own.

text: God judged it better to bring good out of evil than to suffer no evil to exist.

text: For where God built a church, there the Devil would also build a chapel.

text: It is not fitting, when one is in God's service, to have a gloomy face or a chilling look.

text: God doesn't seek for golden vessels, and does not ask for silver ones, but He must have clean ones.

text: Dishonesty is so grasping it would deceive God himself, were it possible.

text: For it pleased God, after he had made all things by the word of his power, to create man after his own image.

text: God is one, but he has innumerable forms. He is the creator of all and He himself takes the human form.

text: I like people and I like them to like me, but I wear my heart where God put it, on the inside.

text: The highest reward that God gives us for good work is the ability to do better work.

text: God is a concept by which we measure our pain.

text: God gave you a gift of 86,400 seconds today. Have you used one to say 'thank you?'

text: Gibson has been making the finest electric guitars the world has ever witnessed for over 70 years. They are as American as God, guns and rock and roll.

text: When I see children, I see the face of God. That's why I love them so much. That's what I see.

author: Meister Eckhart

text: White... is not a mere absence of colour it is a shining and affirmative thing, as fierce as red, as definite as black... God paints in many colours but He never paints so gorgeously, I had almost said so gaudily, as when He paints in white.
author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

text: I try to give to the poor people for love what the rich could get for money. No, I wouldn't touch a leper for a thousand pounds yet I willingly cure him for the love of God.
author: Mother Teresa

text: Call it Nature, Fate, Fortune all these are names of the one and selfsame God.
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

text: Sometimes your medicine bottle has on it, 'Shake well before using.' That is what God has to do with some of His people. He has to shake them well before they are ever usable.
author: Vance Havner

text: God may be in the details, but the goddess is in the questions. Once we begin to ask them, there's no turning back.
author: Gloria Steinem

text: God sent Jesus as an example to see if we could retain and maintain the Holy Spirit in human flesh.
author: Benny Hinn

text: I said to the almond tree, 'Friend, speak to me of God,' and the almond tree blossomed.
author: Nikos Kazantzakis

text: God does not die on the day when we cease to believe in a personal deity, but we die on the day when our lives cease to be illumined by the steady radiance, renewed daily, of a wonder, the source of which is beyond all reason.
author: Dag Hammarskjold

text: It is no use to grumble and complain It's just as cheap and easy to rejoice When God sorts out the weather and sends rain - Why, rain's my choice.
author: James Whitcomb Riley

text: God is not a dead equation!
author: Muhammad Iqbal

text: We need to find God, and he cannot be found in noise and restlessness. God is the friend of silence. See how nature - trees, flowers, grass- grows in silence see the stars, the moon and the sun, how they move in silence... We need silence to be able to touch souls.
author: Mother Teresa

text: A science which does not bring us nearer to God is worthless.
author: Simone Weil

text: I tremble for my country when I reflect that God is just that his justice cannot sleep forever.
author: Thomas Jefferson

text: First, I have to thank God for giving me the gift that he did as well as a second chance for a better life.
author: Oksana Baiul

text: Every test, every trial, every heartache that's been significant, I can turn it over and see how God has turned it into good no matter what.
author: Charles Stanley

text: God is the tangential point between zero and infinity.
author: Alfred Jarry

text: Because one doesn't like the way things are is no reason to be unjust towards God.
author: Victor Hugo

text: Our society strives to avoid any possibility of offending anyone - except God.
author: Billy Graham

text: Even Kings and emperors with heaps of wealth and vast dominion cannot compare with an ant filled with the love of God.
author: Guru Nanak

text: If there is no God, everything is permitted.
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

text: The abdomen is the reason why man does not readily take himself to be a god.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: God as now generally conceived of is only the last witch.
author: Samuel Butler

text: The difficulty for most of us in the modern world is that the old-fashioned idea of God has become incredible or implausible.
author: Alan Watts

text: Every day I feel is a blessing from God. And I consider it a new beginning. Yeah, everything is beautiful.
author: Prince

text: I have lived to thank God that all my prayers have not been answered.
author: Jean Ingelow

text: The only thing that ultimately matters is to eat an ice-cream cone, play a slide trombone, plant a small tree, good God, now you're free.
author: Ray Manzarek

text: I don't have a problem believing in God and Jesus. But in Genesis one has to wonder about these sentences that just go on and end without finishing. The thought is unfinished. Where did Adam go? What is he doing? Hello? There has to be some pages missing.
author: Bill Cosby

text: All God wants of man is a peaceful heart.
author: Meister Eckhart

text: If I have any worth, it is to live my life for God so as to teach these peoples even though some of them still look down on me.
author: Saint Patrick

text: It is common for those that are farthest from God, to boast themselves most of their being near to the Church.
author: Matthew Henry

text: I don't pray because I don't want to bore God.
author: Orson Welles

text: Whatever I will become will be what God has chosen for me.
author: Elvis Presley

text: In their poverty, the mentally handicapped reveal God to us and hold us close to the gospel.
author: Henri Nouwen

text: A year spent in artificial intelligence is enough to make one believe in God.
author: Alan Perlis

text: Where can we go to find God if we cannot see Him in our own hearts and in every living being.
author: Swami Vivekananda

text: The Bible is not man's word about God, but God's word about man.
author: John Barth

text: If God listened to the prayers of men, all men would quickly have perished: for they are forever praying for evil against one another.
author: Epicurus

text: God in His wisdom has decided that He will reward no works but His own.
author: Johannes Tauler

text: Anyone can count the seeds in an apple, but only God can count the number of apples in a seed.
author: Robert H. Schuller

text: The finite is annihilated in the presence of the infinite, and becomes a pure nothing. So our spirit before God, so our justice before divine justice.
author: Blaise Pascal

text: To judge between good or bad, between successful and unsuccessful would take the eye of a God.
author: Anton Chekhov

text: We can stand affliction better than we can prosperity, for in prosperity we forget God.
author: Dwight L. Moody

text: It is incomprehensible that God should exist, and it is incomprehensible that he should not exist.
author: Blaise Pascal

text: I'm not the judge. You know, God didn't tell me to go around judging everybody.
author: Joel Osteen

text: To fall in love is to create a religion that has a fallible god.
author: Jorge Luis Borges

text: I cannot and will not recant anything, for to go against conscience is neither right nor safe. Here I stand, I can do no other, so help me God. Amen.
author: Martin Luther

text: Charity. To love human beings in so far as they are nothing. That is to love them as God does.
author: Simone Weil

text: God has a plan for all of us, but He expects us to do our share of the work.
author: Minnie Pearl

text: The God who gave us life, gave us liberty at the same time.
author: Thomas Jefferson

text: Every morning I wake up and thank God.
author: Aaron Neville

text: I don't stand for the black man's side, I don' t stand for the white man's side. I stand for God's side.
author: Bob Marley

text: One person who has mastered life is better than a thousand persons who have mastered only the contents of books, but no one can get anything out of life without God.
author: Meister Eckhart

text: God gave me a great body and it's my duty to take care of my physical temple.
author: Jean Claude Van Damme

text: Friends are the siblings God never gave us.
author: Mencius

text: Where lipstick is concerned, the important thing is not color, but to accept God's final word on where your lips end.
author: Jerry Seinfeld

text: The dog was created specially for children. He is a god of frolic.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

text: I have so many things to work on, and so many ways that I fail. But that's what grace is all about. and I constantly wake up every morning trying to get better, trying to improve, trying to walk closer to God.
author: Tim Tebow

text: Our life of poverty is as necessary as the work itself. Only in heaven will we see how much we owe to the poor for helping us to love God better because of them.
author: Mother Teresa

text: Earth's crammed with heaven, And every common bush afire with God: But only he who sees takes off his shoes.
author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning

text: God always strives together with those who strive.
author: Aeschylus

text: We are celebrating the feast of the Eternal Birth which God the Father has borne and never ceases to bear in all eternity... But if it takes not place in me, what avails it? Everything lies in this, that it should take place in me.
author: Meister Eckhart

text: God gives the nuts, but he does not crack them.
author: Franz Kafka

text: If God had wanted man to play soccer, he wouldn't have given us arms.
author: Mike Ditka

text: The end of life is to be like God, and the soul following God will be like Him.
author: Socrates

text: Grieve not, then, if your sons seem to desert you, but rejoice, rather, seeing the will of God done gladly.
author: Jim Elliot

text: God expects but one thing of you, and that is that you should come out of yourself in so far as you are a created being made and let God be God in you.
author: Meister Eckhart

text: Small amounts of philosophy lead to atheism, but larger amounts bring us back to God.
author: Francis Bacon

text: Indigestion is charged by God with enforcing morality on the stomach.
author: Victor Hugo

text: The God of this world is riches, pleasure and pride.
author: Martin Luther

text: I try to speak in everyday language. I feel like God has gifted me to take Bible principles and make them practical.
author: Joel Osteen

text: Conscience is God present in man.
author: Victor Hugo

text: God reigns when we take a liberal view, when a liberal view is presented to us.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: Hope is like peace. It is not a gift from God. It is a gift only we can give one another.
author: Elie Wiesel

text: God forbid you be an ugly girl, 'course too pretty is also your doom, 'cause everyone harbors a secret hatred for the prettiest girl in the room.
author: Ani DiFranco

text: I believe in God, but not as one thing, not as an old man in the sky. I believe that what people call God is something in all of us. I believe that what Jesus and Mohammed and Buddha and all the rest said was right. It's just that the translations have gone wrong.
author: John Lennon

text: We steal if we touch tomorrow. It is God's.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

text: God had brought me to my knees and made me acknowledge my own nothingness, and out of that knowledge I had been reborn. I was no longer the centre of my life and therefore I could see God in everything.
author: Bede Griffiths

text: Einstein, stop telling God what to do!
author: Niels Bohr

text: You are a child of God. Your playing small does not serve the world. There is nothing enlightened about shrinking so that other people won't feel insecure about you. We were born to manifest the glory of God that is within us.
author: Marianne Williamson

text: The will is a beast of burden. If God mounts it, it wishes and goes as God wills if Satan mounts it, it wishes and goes as Satan wills Nor can it choose its rider... the riders contend for its possession.
author: Martin Luther

text: It is not a God, just and good, but a devil, under the name of God, that the Bible describes.
author: Thomas Paine

text: What God intended for you goes far beyond anything you can imagine.
author: Oprah Winfrey

text: While I know myself as a creation of God, I am also obligated to realize and remember that everyone else and everything else are also God's creation.
author: Maya Angelou

text: I will govern my life and thoughts as if the whole world were to see the one and read the other, for what does it signify to make anything a secret to my neighbor, when to God, who is the searcher of our hearts, all our privacies are open?
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

text: If you want to make God laugh, tell him about your plans.
author: Woody Allen

text: I tremble for my country when I hear of confidence expressed in me. I know too well my weakness, that our only hope is in God.
author: Robert E. Lee

text: Eskimo: 'If I did not know about God and sin, would I go to hell?' Priest: 'No, not if you did not know.' Eskimo: 'Then why did you tell me?'
author: Annie Dillard

text: Man must feel the earth to know himself and recognize his values... God made life simple. It is man who complicates it.
author: Charles Lindbergh

text: When you believe in God, you've got to believe in the all-powerful God. He's not just God, He's the all-powerful God and He has total control over everyone's life. The Devil, on the other hand, is a real character that's trying his hardest to tear your life apart.
author: Alice Cooper

text: Risk is a part of God's game, alike for men and nations.
author: Warren Buffett

text: Man - a creature made at the end of the week's work when God was tired.
author: Mark Twain

text: Power always thinks... that it is doing God's service when it is violating all his laws.
author: John Adams

text: On the field I'm trying to play for the glory of God but then also I'm trying to give everything I have and win and compete. And so I think more than just winning or losing, I think He cares about where our hearts are when we're playing.
author: Tim Tebow

text: Great thoughts and a pure heart, that is what we should ask from God.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

text: Before we can know God and understand his great plan it is first necessary for us to believe that he exists and that he rewards all who diligently seek him.
author: Joseph Franklin Rutherford

text: The Bible is clear - God's definition of marriage is between a man and a woman.
author: Billy Graham

text: The Bible is one of the greatest blessings bestowed by God on the children of men. It has God for its author salvation for its end, and truth without any mixture for its matter. It is all pure.
author: John Locke

text: My dream is to live a good life and be loving, be close to God and be a good human being and bring peace to people.
author: Ziggy Marley

text: God is like the sun. When the sun shines, it shines for everyone. God is for everyone.
author: Ziggy Marley

text: Let us raise a standard to which the wise and honest can repair the rest is in the hands of God.
author: George Washington

text: God gave us faculties for our use each of them will receive its proper reward. Then do not let us try to charm them to sleep, but permit them to do their work until divinely called to something higher.
author: Saint Teresa of Avila

text: He who is unable to live in society, or who has no need because he is sufficient for himself, must be either a beast or a god.
author: Aristotle

text: I want to love all the children of God - Christian, Jew, Moslem, Hindu, Buddhist - everyone. I want to love gay Christians and straight Christians.
author: Anne Rice

text: Theology is a science of mind applied to God.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

text: War is God's way of teaching Americans geography.
author: Ambrose Bierce

text: Whatever comes from God is impossible for a man to turn back.
author: Herodotus

text: It is not all bad, this getting old, ripening. After the fruit has got its growth it should juice up and mellow. God forbid I should live long enough to ferment and rot and fall to the ground in a squash.
author: Josh Billings

text: A baby is God's opinion that life should go on.
author: Carl Sandburg

text: God has placed no limits to the exercise of the intellect he has given us, on this side of the grave.
author: Francis Bacon

text: I actually pray everyday, but I don't believe in God.
author: Harvey Fierstein

text: The years like great black oxen tread the world, and God, the herdsman goads them on behind, and I am broken by their passing feet.
author: William Butler Yeats

text: But I know God has big stuff planned that ultimately doesn't have anything to do with me.
author: Michael W. Smith

text: Yesterday is history, tomorrow is a mystery, today is God's gift, that's why we call it the present.
author: Joan Rivers

text: I've always believed in God. I also think that's the sort of thing that either comes as part of the equipment, the capacity to believe, or at some point in your life, when you're in a position where you actually need help from a power greater than yourself, you simply make an agreement.
author: Stephen King

text: Like the old soldier of the ballad, I now close my military career and just fade away, an old soldier who tried to do his duty as God gave him the light to see that duty. Goodbye.
author: Douglas MacArthur

text: The reproduction of mankind is a great marvel and mystery. Had God consulted me in the matter, I should have advised him to continue the generation of the species by fashioning them out of clay.
author: Martin Luther

text: One and God make a majority.
author: Frederick Douglass

text: Those whom God wishes to destroy, he first makes mad.
author: Euripides

text: I still have a spiritual base and a spiritual foundation. And my conversation with God is very open-ended. I pray for humility, honestly, because it's very easy to be caught up in this world.
author: Katy Perry

text: God helps those who help themselves.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: I think God's going to come down and pull civilization over for speeding.
author: Steven Wright

text: If you don't want my God here, you don't want me here either. God has been too good to me to go and try to sell out to get some money.
author: Tyler Perry

text: There are two kinds of people one can call reasonable: those who serve God with all their heart because they know him, and those who seek him with all their heart because they do not know him.
author: Blaise Pascal

text: Well, I'll put it this way: you can certainly say belief in God makes people behave worse. That can be proved beyond a doubt.
author: Christopher Hitchens

text: If one could conclude as to the nature of the Creator from a study of his creation it would appear that God has a special fondness for stars and beetles.
author: John B. S. Haldane

text: If God did not exist, it would be necessary to invent Him.
author: Voltaire

text: I'm an atheist and I thank God for it.
author: George Bernard Shaw

text: Every creature is a word of God.
author: Meister Eckhart

text: Well, we can't say any more than we can say there is no god, there is no afterlife. We can only say there is no persuasive evidence for or argument for it.
author: Christopher Hitchens

text: I wished to God the doctor had handed me a pamphlet that said, 'Hey, sorry about the autism, but here's a step-by-step list on what to do next.' But doctors don't do that. They say 'sorry' and move you along.
author: Jenny McCarthy

text: I have never made but one prayer to God, a very short one: 'O Lord make my enemies ridiculous.' And God granted it.
author: Voltaire

text: Theology made no provision for evolution. The biblical authors had missed the most important revelation of all! Could it be that they were not really privy to the thoughts of God?
author: E. O. Wilson

text: God wants to bless us where we are.
author: Joel Osteen

text: But at any rate, the point is that God is what nobody admits to being, and everybody really is.
author: Alan Watts

text: Ignorance is the curse of God knowledge is the wing wherewith we fly to heaven.
author: William Shakespeare

text: God not only plays dice, but also sometimes throws them where they cannot be seen.
author: Stephen Hawking

text: And I will do everything that I can as long as I am President of the United States to remind the American people that we are one nation under God, and we may call that God different names but we remain one nation.
author: Barack Obama

text: And God help Bruce Springsteen when they decide he's no longer God... They'll turn on him, and I hope he survives it.
author: John Lennon
